result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Eric G Kaster in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pursuant to negotiations, court orders case dismissed and read in for sentencing in 15CM1605.
Cash bail to be returned to surety.

Attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer in court, defendant Eric G Kaster not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
For reasons stated on the record, court orders bench warrant withdrawn and bail reinstated.  Defense counsel requests a plea/sentencing date.  Case adjourned to Branch 38.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Samantha L.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by portable breathalyzers.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Eric G Kaster in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Eric G Kaster in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
